comment._content: I wonder if the sign at the top of No.4 Bridge Street (now an apartment block called Cliveden) was for passing biplanes with airmail?

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Historic Sydney, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 92723869@N07
comment._content: The telegraph poles would indicate that this photo was taken earlier than 1930s, as also the horse-drawn vehicle in the bottom R corner. Another photo by Sam Hood from c1900 looking down Bridge St from George shows the same smaller telegraph pole in front of the previous 2-storey building at No 4 Bridge. All that we need now is to find when the current 12-storey building was built, which will give us the earliest possible date.

comment.author: 92723869@N07
comment._content: OK! According to NSW Heritage listing, Birts Building, now Cliveden, at 4 Bridge Street was completed in 1915. The site was formerly occupied by W.N. Beaumont & Company’s Federal Electrical and Engineering Works, a two storey brick warehouse building.
